intro: Gonzalagunia ovatifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed gonzalagunia, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its ovate, narrow leaves and clusters of small, pale pink or white flowers. It typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Gonzalagunia ovatifolia is adapted to humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological diversity of its native habitat.
